description: Dance Powder is a green powder that can create artificial rain by accelerating the formation of ice particles in sub-freezing temperature clouds. When burned, it creates vapor that rises into the atmosphere and causes immediate heavy rainfall. However, it cannot create new water—it only redirects existing rainfall from one area to another, causing severe droughts in surrounding regions.

properties.activation: Must be burned to create vapor
properties.effect: Artificial rainfall creation through cloud seeding

keyMoments.title: Dance Powder Explanation
keyMoments.description: Vivi and Nami explain the mechanism and consequences of Dance Powder to the crew during their desert journey. They detail how it was used to frame King Cobra and create civil unrest in Arabasta.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the scientific and political mechanism behind Arabasta's drought and rebellion, showing how Crocodile manipulated the kingdom.

historicalSignificance: Dance Powder's use historically caused wars between nations due to its environmental consequences. The devastation was so severe that the World Government prohibited its manufacturing, possession, and use worldwide, with violation punishable by death.

banDetails.reason: Caused wars due to environmental manipulation and drought creation

usage.purpose: Create artificial drought and frame Arabasta's king
usage.outcome: Successfully destabilized Arabasta and turned citizens against King Cobra

reveals.information: Dance Powder accelerates ice particle formation in clouds but cannot create new water, only redirect existing rainfall
Using Dance Powder in one location causes droughts in surrounding areas, leading to conflicts and wars
The World Government banned Dance Powder worldwide with death as the penalty for its use

realWorldInspiration: Dance Powder is based on the real-world practice of cloud seeding using silver iodide, which can promote precipitation by providing nucleation sites for ice crystal formation in clouds.
culturalImpact: Dance Powder represents the dangers of environmental manipulation and serves as a plot device showing how Baroque Works engineered Arabasta's civil war through artificial drought creation.
